info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 4:49PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... At 449 PM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Old Santee Canal State Park, or near Moncks Corner, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Moncks Corner, Bonneau, Jamestown, Old Santee Canal State Park and Pinopolis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
